column1: Tim was in the kitchen, ready to make lunch. Tim wanted to make a big bowl of pasta. The pasta box was full. Tim believed the pasta box was full. While Tim was busy cutting vegetables, his little sister came into the kitchen and took some pasta to play with. Tim does not see his sister leaving the kitchen with some pasta in her hand.
column2: Does Tim think the pasta box is full or not?
column3: Tim believes the pasta box is full.
column4: Tim believes the pasta box is not full.

column1: Fiona was at the park with her friends. They wanted to play a game of soccer. The ball they had was clean and shiny. Fiona believed the ball was clean and shiny. While they were playing, the ball rolled into a muddy puddle and got dirty. Fiona does not see the ball in the muddy puddle.
column2: Does Fiona think the ball is clean or dirty?
column3: Fiona believes the ball is clean.
column4: Fiona believes the ball is dirty.

column1: Olivia was at the park, sitting on a bench. Olivia wanted to feed the ducks with her bag of bread. The bread was fresh and smelled good. Olivia believed the bread was fresh and smelled good. While Olivia was watching the ducks, a naughty squirrel snuck over to the bench and took a piece of bread, dropping it into a muddy puddle. Olivia does not see the squirrel run away with a piece of bread.
column2: Does Olivia think the bread is fresh and smells good or is dirty and smells bad?
column3: Olivia believes the bread is fresh and smells good.
column4: Olivia believes the bread is dirty and smells bad.

column1: John was at the park, sitting on a bench. John wanted to propose to his girlfriend and marry her. His ring box was in his cap. John believed the ring was in his cap. While John was busy looking at the squirrels, a hairy dog came and picked up the cap, shaking it and making the ring fall out. John does not see the dog with his cap in its mouth.
column2: Does John think the ring is in his cap or not?
column3: John believes the ring is in his cap.
column4: John believes the ring is not in his cap.

column1: Vinny was in the gloomy hall of his school. He wanted to zoom around on his new roller skates. The hall was empty. Vinny believed the hall was empty. column4: Vinny believes the hall is slippery.

column1: Quin was at the park with his friends. Quin wanted to show his friends he was brave. The park's gate was locked. Quin believed the gate was locked. While Quin was daring his friends to race, the park keeper came and unlocked the gate. Quin does not see the park keeper unlocking the gate.
